page.title: 01Holkham Park and New Holkham
page.content: This block is a mixture of parkland woodland and agricultureal. What was previously all grassland, has been ploughed and cultivated. It is part of the Holkham estate, founded by Coke of Norfolk. The estate in its heyday was a model for agriculturalists to emulate. Totally self supporting, it fell into decline but now under Viscount coke is steadily regaining its lost glory. Totally agricultural in all aspects farming is the only industry. Small model village. Triumphal arches and obelisk the whole Landscape is manmade No shops, no pubs, nothing, but a group of houses, but they have a post box.
